1.course name: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS)
1.course description: MBBS is a professional undergraduate degree that prepares students for careers as medical doctors.
1.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB subjects and qualifying medical entrance exam
1.course curriculum: Anatomy, Physiology, Biochemistry, Pharmacology, Clinical Medicine, Surgery, etc.
1.course structure: Divided into pre-clinical and clinical phases, including internship.

2.course description: This program focuses on dental science and prepares students for careers as dentists.
2.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB subjects and qualifying dental entrance exam
2.course curriculum: Dental Anatomy, Oral Medicine, Surgery, Orthodontics, etc.

3.course description: BPharm covers pharmaceutical sciences and prepares students for careers in the pharmaceutical industry.
3.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB or PCM subjects and qualifying pharmacy entrance exam
3.course curriculum: Pharmacology, Medicinal Chemistry, Pharmaceutics, Pharmacognosy, etc.
3.course structure: Includes theory, lab work, and practical training.

4.course description: BMLT equips students with the skills needed to work in medical laboratories and conduct tests.
4.career opportunities: Medical lab technologist, lab supervisor, research assistant
4.course curriculum: Clinical Biochemistry, Hematology, Microbiology, Pathology, etc.
4.course structure: Includes lab work and clinical training.

5.course name: Diploma courses in operation theatre technology, medical laboratory, x-ray technology
5.course description: Diploma programs provide specialized training for healthcare support roles in various fields.
5.career opportunities: Operation theatre technician, lab technician, radiology technician
5.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB subjects (may vary by program)

1.course description: BTech programs offer specialized training in engineering and technology.
1.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCM subjects and qualifying engineering entrance exam
1.course curriculum: Core engineering subjects, electives, and practical labs

2.course description: BSc programs provide a broad-based education in science, including physics, chemistry, and mathematics.

3.course description: This program focuses on nuclear medicine technology for diagnosis and therapy.
3.course curriculum: Radiopharmaceuticals, Imaging Techniques, Nuclear Medicine Procedures, etc.
3.course structure: Combination of theory and practical training.

4.course description: Merchant Navy courses prepare individuals for careers in the maritime industry as officers or crew members.
4.course duration: Varies by program (e.g., 3-year BSc Nautical Science)
4.career opportunities: Deck officer, marine engineer, navigation officer
4.eligibility requirements: Varies by program, typically 10+2 with PCM subjects
4.course structure: Combination of academic study and sea training.

5.course description: Forensic science programs teach students the principles and techniques of solving crimes through scientific analysis.
5.career opportunities: Forensic scientist, crime scene investigator, forensic analyst
5.course curriculum: Forensic chemistry, DNA analysis, crime scene investigation, etc.

6.course description: Criminology programs study the causes and consequences of crime, as well as criminal justice systems.
6.course curriculum: Criminological theories, criminal law, criminal justice systems, etc.
6.course structure: Combines theory, research, and practical aspects.

1.course description: BTech programs offer specialized training in engineering and technology.
1.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCM or PCB subjects and qualifying engineering entrance exam
1.course curriculum: Core engineering subjects, biotechnology courses, and practical labs

2.course description: Molecular biology programs focus on the study of biological molecules and genetic processes.
2.course curriculum: Molecular genetics, DNA analysis, cellular biology, etc.

3.course description: Forensic science programs teach students the principles and techniques of solving crimes through scientific analysis.
3.career opportunities: Forensic scientist, crime scene investigator, forensic analyst
3.course curriculum: Forensic chemistry, DNA analysis, crime scene investigation, etc.

4.course description: Biochemical engineering programs combine biology and engineering principles for biotechnology applications.
4.career opportunities: Biochemical engineer, bioprocess engineer, pharmaceutical researcher
4.course curriculum: Biochemical kinetics, Bioprocess engineering, Bioinformatics, etc.

5.course description: Biochemists study the chemical processes and substances within living organisms.
5.course curriculum: Biochemical pathways, Enzyme kinetics, Molecular biology, etc.
5.course structure: Focuses on biochemistry principles and lab work.

6.course description: Dentistry programs train students to become dental professionals who diagnose and treat oral health issues.
6.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB subjects and qualifying dental entrance exam
6.course curriculum: Dental Anatomy, Oral Medicine, Surgery, Orthodontics, etc.

7.course description: Medical programs leading to a Doctor of Medicine (MD) or equivalent degree, preparing students to become medical doctors.
7.eligibility requirements: 10+2 with PCB subjects and qualifying medical entrance exam
7.course curriculum: Anatomy, Physiology, Biochemistry, Pharmacology, Clinical Medicine, Surgery, etc.
7.course structure: Divided into pre-clinical and clinical phases, including internship.

1.course description: BCom programs provide a strong foundation in commerce and business studies.

2.course description: Chartered Accountancy is a professional accounting qualification.
2.eligibility requirements: 10+2 in any stream (Foundation course) or graduate degree (Direct Entry)
2.course curriculum: Financial reporting, taxation, audit and assurance, etc.
2.course structure: Consists of multiple levels of exams.

3.course description: Cost Accountancy focuses on costing and financial management.
3.career opportunities: Cost accountant, financial analyst, budget analyst
3.eligibility requirements: 10+2 in any stream (Foundation course) or graduate degree (Direct Entry)
3.course curriculum: Cost accounting, financial management, business strategy, etc.
3.course structure: Involves multiple levels of exams and practical training.

4.course description: BBA programs provide a comprehensive understanding of business management.
4.course curriculum: Business management, marketing, finance, human resources, etc.

5.course description: BEcon programs focus on economics principles and their applications.

6.course description: Journalism and mass communication programs prepare students for careers in media, journalism, and communication.
6.career opportunities: Journalist, public relations specialist, media producer
6.course curriculum: Journalism ethics, media production, communication theory, etc.
6.course structure: Combines theory, practical training, and internships.

1.course description: BA programs offer a broad-based education in the arts and humanities.

2.course description: BFA programs focus on various forms of visual and performing arts.
2.career opportunities: Visual artist, actor, designer, art teacher
2.eligibility requirements: 10+2 in any stream (specific art entrance exam may be required)
2.course structure: Combines studio practice, theory, and exhibitions.

3.course description: BBA programs provide a comprehensive understanding of business management.
3.course curriculum: Business management, marketing, finance, human resources, etc.

4.course name: Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication (B.J.M.)
4.course description: Journalism and mass communication programs prepare students for careers in media, journalism, and communication.
4.career opportunities: Journalist, public relations specialist, media producer
4.course curriculum: Journalism ethics, media production, communication theory, etc.
4.course structure: Combines theory, practical training, and internships.

5.course description: BFD programs focus on fashion design, garment creation, and fashion industry knowledge.
5.career opportunities: Fashion designer, fashion stylist, apparel merchandiser
5.eligibility requirements: 10+2 in any stream (specific fashion design entrance exam may be required)
5.course curriculum: Fashion sketching, textile design, fashion marketing, etc.
5.course structure: Combines design studio work, theory, and fashion shows.

6.course description: BHM programs prepare students for careers in the hospitality and hotel industry.
6.career opportunities: Hotel manager, event planner, restaurant manager
6.course curriculum: Hospitality management, food and beverage service, hotel operations, etc.
6.course structure: Includes practical training in hotels and internships.
